thread.section_title: US Stock Market News - Dow Jones, Nasdaq, S&P 500 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Conoco moves to take over Venezuelan PDVSA's Caribbean assets -sources

author: Marianna Parraga
title: Conoco moves to take over Venezuelan PDVSA's Caribbean assets -sources
text:
HOUSTON, May 6 (Reuters) - U.S. oil firm ConocoPhillips has moved to take Caribbean assets of Venezuela’s state-run PDVSA to enforce a $2 billion arbitration award over a decade-oil nationalization of its projects in the South American country, according to two sources familiar with its actions.
The U.S. firm targeted Caribbean facilities on the islands of Bonaire and St. Eustatius that play critical roles in PDVSA’s oil exports, the country’s main source of revenue. PDVSA relies on the terminals to process, store and blend its oil.
“We will work with the community and local authorities to address issues that may arise as a result of enforcement actions,” ConocoPhillips said in a statement to Reuters. (Reporting by Marianna Parraga and Gary McWilliams; Editing by Sandra Maler)
